16cc7efe-e591-4a8f-845b-8a94558824a6.description: This certification program introduces users to fundamental critical infrastructure protection concepts, how to navigate the OPSWAT certification program requirements, and how to operate the OPSWAT Academy user interface. Topics include identifying the meaning of a critical network, defining critical infrastructure protection (CIP), identifying the purpose of the OPSWAT Academy, and defining the OPSWAT Academy certificate program structure.
16cc7efe-e591-4a8f-845b-8a94558824a6.name: OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP)

badge_template_activities.title: Users are required to pass a final exam to earn both a certificate and to unlock the OPSWAT OFSA and OECA programs.

5bb59bcd-2a2b-43c2-98e8-eb4359837a69.description: Objectives for the OFSA certificate program target the knowledge and skills required to competently protect critical network file systems. These include identifying the risks associated with unsecured file uploads, explaining the difference between static and dynamic analysis, and identifying assets used to protect against known and unknown threats.
5bb59bcd-2a2b-43c2-98e8-eb4359837a69.name: OPSWAT File Security Associate (OFSA)

badge_template_activities.title: The OFSA Final Exam consists of testing a cross section of the four OFSA courses. This includes, but is not limited to questions regarding malware types, hacker targets, zero day attacks, vulnerable systems, static & dynamic analysis, CVE's, CDR, security integration, and security stacking.

dc3db466-f757-443d-bbd2-155e4d3c1070.description: The OECA certification program covers techniques and best practices for securing endpoints. It consists of four courses with material to assist in identifying multiple topics such as security enforcement methodologies that maximize enforcement without decreasing productivity, local device security policies, security issues associated with BYOD endpoints, and hacker targets, exploitation methodologies & potentially unwanted applications.
dc3db466-f757-443d-bbd2-155e4d3c1070.name: OPSWAT Endpoint Compliance Associate (OECA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course. Additionally, Academy users must pass this final exam for OECA before they can register for ONSA or OMAP.

784a2c0a-8b1c-40c5-a515-99058fcc2212.description: The ONSA certification program covers techniques and best practices for securing networks It consists of three courses that will assist in identifying the risks and vulnerabilities of unsecured networks, explaining network enforcement tool type methodologies, and defining the difference between layer two and three NAC deployments along with identifying network security principles.
784a2c0a-8b1c-40c5-a515-99058fcc2212.name: OPSWAT Network Security Associate (ONSA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course. Academy users must also pass this final exam for ONSA before they can register for OMNP.

4a5d5a50-d985-441a-b640-abb0a81308b5.description: This certificate program covers the Purdue Model, Demilitarized Zones (DMZ), and familiarize users with Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT) concepts. It consists of four courses including material on identifying the fundamental structure of the Purdue Model, the risks of using removable media and transient cyber assets, and demonstrating the secure transfer of data to air-gapped networks.
4a5d5a50-d985-441a-b640-abb0a81308b5.name: OPSWAT Data Transfer Security Associate (ODSA)

badge_template_activities.title: The OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course must be completed prior to completing the OPSWAT Data Transfer Security Associate (ODSA) course and exam. The ODSA final exam includes topics on securing transient cyber assets & removable media, securing the air-gap and limiting exposure.

cae452b8-874a-4925-a5b7-767e5f7932c2.description: This certificate program will provide an overview of the types of data stored on critical networks, the risks associated with commonly used storage and transfer methods, and how to secure it from threats. It will consist of six courses and 15 topic areas. These include identifying the risks of data at rest, correlating the relationship between antivirus vendor definition updates and existing file storage and transferring and storing files from low to high security networks.
cae452b8-874a-4925-a5b7-767e5f7932c2.name: OPSWAT Secure Storage Associate (OSSA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course as well as pass the final exams for the OFSA and ODSA certification programs before registering for the OSSA course.

e4eeb608-731e-4a0d-81fe-30661e03424c.description: The OWPA certification program covers techniques and best practices for securing web traffic. It consists of three courses covering the security risks and vulnerabilities associated with internet-based threats, security methodologies that can be implemented to secure web traffic, and identifying best practices for securing local endpoints from internet-based threats.
e4eeb608-731e-4a0d-81fe-30661e03424c.name: OPSWAT Web Traffic Protection Associate (OWPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course as well as pass the final exam for OFSA before they can register for OWPA.

257fc84a-343e-4422-9653-2b336ef73a88.description: The OESA certification program covers techniques and best practices for securing email data flows. It consists of three courses that cover the risks associated with social engineering and the handling of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) over email, the reason why end user education and the employment of security technology are critical to securing email, and the components of an email and how security tools should be deployed and configured to protect email servers.
257fc84a-343e-4422-9653-2b336ef73a88.name: OPSWAT Email Security Associate (OESA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course as well as pass the final exam for OFSA before they can register for OESA.

76c8cab1-15c8-4bfd-ba3e-0d5cacc88b58.description: he OLSA certification program covers techniques and best practices for securing legacy systems. It consists of three courses that cover why legacy systems are still in use and the challenges securing them, methodologies used to secure legacy systems, identifying air-gap regulations, and identifying trends in use with legacy systems and methodologies used to control network traffic direction in legacy systems.
76c8cab1-15c8-4bfd-ba3e-0d5cacc88b58.name: OPSWAT Legacy System Associate (OLSA)

badge_template_activities.title: Users must first complete the OPSWAT Introduction to Critical Infrastructure Protection (ICIP) course as well as pass the final exams for the OFSA and ODSA certifications before they can register for OLSA.
